newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thailand okays equity shortsale, securitisation.
newsitem.headline: Thailand okays equity shortsale, securitisation.

text.p: The Thai economic cabinet on Tuesday approved proposals to legalise equity shortsale, stock lending and securitisation of property sector debt.

Prasarn Trairatvorakul, deputy secretary general of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), said the cabinet decision, designed to boost the weak Thai stock market and troubled property sector, would need to go through a law drafting process and parliament ratification.
SEC and stock exchange officials have said earlier that legalising equity shortsale would help boost liquidity in the stock market.
Prasarn did not detail the approved proposals but said they would allow banks and brokerage firms to seek licenses for undertaking stock lending business related to equity shortsale.
He said a new organisation would be set up under the SEC to act as trustee for securitised assets and equities. He did not elaborate.

The Thai property sector is reeling under a four-year slump with no immediate recovery in sight. Its troubles have threatened stability of some financial institutions with large exposure to the sector.
